title: 11. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Assessing Biotic Influences at Maximum Tillering (16 February 2012)

tasks.task: Assessing biotic influences on rice crop
subtasks: Evaluating insect-related damage
Identifying weed presence and assessing their impact
Monitoring disease progression on the crop
Observing animal pests and their impact
Collecting data at maximum tillering stage

tasks.task: Collecting data for biological pest assessment
subtasks: Using specific tools for pest collection
Sampling for varied pests

tasks.task: Managing rodent damage in the rice field
subtasks: Implementing rodent control methods
Monitoring gaps in the crop

tasks.task: Assessing biotic influences on rice crop
subtasks: Inspecting rice crop for insect pests
Using sweep net and tapping method to count flying and sucking insects
Sampling weeds from three 1m x 1m areas
Noting weed types and their relation to crop canopy height
Checking for viral, bacterial, and fungal diseases
Collecting data on disease injuries using a data sheet
Noting rodent damage (eaten rice plants, gaps created)
Assessing effectiveness of current rodent control measures
Documenting stages of crop development and biological interactions
Reassessing the crop at different growth stages for updated data

tasks.task: Collecting data for biological pest assessment
subtasks: Using quadrat (1 healing transplanted rice equivalent) for sampling
Using sweep net and pan with water (detergent) for insect counting
Counting green leaf hoppers
Detecting plant hoppers (types mentioned)
Identifying and counting rice bugs

tasks.task: Managing rodent damage in the rice field
subtasks: Enhancing existing programs to reduce rat activity
Protecting emerging areas from rodent destruction
Regularly checking for new bare areas
Evaluating the effectiveness of pest control measures
